lebanese.usage_note: More common than religious greeting in casual settings

phrases.cultural_notes: In Morocco universal regardless of religiosity. In Lebanon/Syria, 'marhaba' more common in casual settings.
Response is 'صباح النور' (morning of light) across all dialects
In Darija, 'labas' both asks and answers 'how are you'. Very versatile.
Lebanese often use 'merci' due to French influence
Darija 'juj' is unique - very different from other dialects
Very important phrase - different in each dialect
Darija uses 'msha' for go/walk, others use 'rah' (went)
